alert.note: Alert for Wells (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 24 at 4:13PM CDT until June 24 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: The National Weather Service in Bismarck has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Wells County in south central North Dakota... * Until 815 PM CDT. * At 413 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible across northern Wells County. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fessenden, Heimdal, Bremen, Manfred and Hamberg. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
